text: So motion sequences for iPhone 5 an 6+ are fully exported, cut up into the 3 separate clips for each. Mocked up screenshots of actual exported assets for each phone and they look good to me (I have them on the devices at my desk if anyone wants to see). Still would like to test battery drain on phone with <@U0289USNA>.

And <@U0260V1BX>, I misplaced the device list for Android, could you resend that so I can measure out export sizes for the target devices? I'll also need to know what resolution each device is in if you know, right now I'm just focusing on what's needed for the target devices.

Galaxy S5, S4, Note 3, Sony Z3: 1920x1080 px
Note 4: 2560x1440

text: I would suggest just cutting android assets once since they're all the same dpi. You could get a little crazy with it and make more alternatives based on dpi+screen size, but I'm not sure that the Notes actually fall into different size buckets either. The final result may appear differently on each screen, but that's kind of the nature of Android and assets.
It's kinda hard to say without implementing it myself
I'm confused about how these links tell me the Note 3 is at 386 ppi and the Note 4 is at 515 ppi, does that mean something else?
those numbers are probably right. dpi and ppi are closely related, but the buckets that android uses are rather large.
Got it.
Thanks Kat!
yeah thank you kat. this is still so confusing.
best to just embrace the chaos
sorry, wish I had better answers, but so much of it depends on how it is implemented.
no worries!

I think I'll just draw the one based off of what psd we provided, and if they end up needing a new version drawn for the Note 4 I can provide that upon request (though I have a hunch they might just try making it work instead of asking for a new size).
